results.title: Bali: the release of a soul
results.creator_credit: John Phillips, Ted Myers and United Cinema
results.brief_description: To the Balinese, life and religion are one. The film explains this as it explains some aspects of the school system, religion and village life, to the accompaniment of gamelan music.

results.title: The Balance sheet barrier: business finance for non-specialists (NP)
results.brief_description: Defines the business finance terms of share capital, loan capital, reserves, fixed assets, working capital, profit, overheads and cash flow. Emphasises that the speed at which working capital turns around is central to the profitability of a business. Illustrates that the balance sheet, the profit and loss account and the cash flow forecast are expressions of the present, past and future. Intended for management, induction training for staff recruited to financial departments and for senior schools. Starring John Cleese and Ronnie Corbett.

results.title: Balance 1950
results.brief_description: Animated drawings showing the balance sheet of Imperial Chemical Industries for 1950. Vivacious little “match stick” men, aided by ever active “Pound” and other devices perform against a backdrop of graphs and ledgers. An interesting example of simplified animation technique in which an unpopular subject is treated in an entertaining way.

results.title: Balablok
results.creator_credit: Brent Walker Film Productions, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated replay of the human comedy as amusing in its perception as in the way it caricatures man’s propensity to resort to violence rather than reason. The whole area of conflict is reduced to its simplest dimensions - cubes and balls representing opposing protagonists. Why they fight and what happens after the battle is a parody of human nature. A film without commentary. (Awards: Palme d’Or, Cannes; Colombo; Buenos Aires)

results.title: The Badminton Horse Trials
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: A record of the three-day event at the 1962 Badminton Horse Trials, showing famous riders and their mounts in training and the preparations made for transport and stabling. Events include dressage, cross country steeple chasing and show jumping. the Queen attends and presents prizes.

results.title: Baden Powell: chief scout of the world
results.brief_description: The life story of the founder of the Boy Scout Movement, compiled form original film records. His early life is shown by linking photographs and his personal sketches of such important events as the Ashanti campaign and the siege of Mafeking. From its unofficial beginning in South Africa the Movement is traced to the Boy Scout groups which Baden-Powell established all over Britain. He is seen attending world jamboree as World Chief Scout, and excerpts from his addresses are given. No other credits available.

results.title: Backyard theatre: Michel Tremblay and Andre Brassard
results.creator_credit: Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Playwright Michel Tremblay and director Andre Bassard have a talent for capturing the earthy wit and language of Montreal’s east-end working class neighbourhood, rendering them into live theatre described by some critics as “outrageously funny”. Both their vision and their style have had an important influence on other Quebec artists.
results.title_for_label: Backyard theatre: Michel Tremblay and Andre Brassard

results.title: Back to life
results.creator_credit: Al Kane and Al Kane Productions
results.brief_description: A skilled factory worker suffers a nervous breakdown as a result of tensions and personality conflicts on the job and enters a mental hospital. He is diagnosed as a schizophrenic-paranoiac type. Calm, psychotherapy and occupational therapy restore him to good health. Through the support of friends, family, a social worker and a rehabilitation worker he adjusts to a normal life and is able to return to his job.

results.title: The Back of Beyond
results.creator_credit: John Heyer, Shell Film Unit, Janet Heyer and Roland Robinson
results.brief_description: Heyer’s romantic impression of life in the inland of Australia featuring the Birdsville Track and its postman, Tom Kruse. Highlights the isolation of the people on outback stations and small towns, and the importance in their lives of the postman and the pedal wireless. Notable in the history of documentary for its strong visuals and use of natural speech, and for being the first production of the Shell Film Unit in Australia. Commentary spoken by Kevin Brennan.
